desc: Locks are used to guard strongly consistent metadata state
Provides less guarantees about the state of metadata and is weaker than per-request strong consistency.
Inodes are cached on both the client and server, facilitating local metadata reads/updates
The structure that metadata event updates are materialized, processed, and stored with
Semantics of durability (which are not defined by POSIX IO): global durability (updates always safe) local durability (potential metadata loss if node dies and stays down)
